description: This schema represents the output of a model developed by Hovsepian et. al. (UbiComp 2015) that uses inputs denoting physiological arousal to find episodes of a person's being stressed.

references.description: The Psychology Ontology code represents Physiological arousal, defined as Condition of alertness and readiness to respond as evidenced by physiological signs such as heart rate or blood pressure.
Finding Significant Stress Episodes in a Discontinuous Time Series of Rapidly Varying Mobile Sensor Data

effective_time_frame.description: As a measure describing a duration, stress episode should not be associated to a date time time frame. Hence, effective time frame is restricted to be a time interval.
